page.title: 11Smarden - Local Goverment
page.content: Smarden residents are represented in the British & European parliaments, the Kent County and Ashford Borough Councils and the Parish Council. All elections take place in the village hall with an above average turn out. The County and Borough Councils organise meetings on matters of local interest such as planning which are lively and well attended. The annual parish meeting takes place in April when the 9 councillors report to and are questioned by the electorate. Particular interest is shown in planning with the aim of preserving the village's unique character. The council's duty is to advise the borough on planning, housing and traffic and to manage the parish property - the burial ground, sports grounds and the parish pump - for which they receive a penny rate.
